intro: Oreocharis concava var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
